Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan was making drastic shifts from tradition to modernization under political ideology. This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense due to this time in history and while many people flourish now, there is still many that suffer due to past troubles.

Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surfer dudes from Broken Bay in New South Wales. But there is something fishy going on... Taking up with hairier inhabitants of the forest nearby, Chilloco and Wazzo, the boys slow down and watch the turnabouts that can happen in life.

This is a fine musical with a timeless score by one of my favorite composers (Gershwin) and a nice 'Parisien' atmosphere which gives the Bostonians, well Bostonians as it were, plenty of opportunity to affect their best snooty hauteur. Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most enjoyable work of kubrick they've seen. This movie is good for only one thing; awkwardly looking as you recognize your own friends playing minor roles.

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay let's break it down. Let's start with the title of the movie: " The Mule ". What is a mule? Is that a manatee? Or something similar to porky pig?
The story revolves around three month old elf Audrey who just moved into her sand pails house with her dad

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
Takes what it needs from earlier pics and stretches the imagination to do something considered in my opinion financially safe yet undeniably --and sometimes unavoidably-- disturbing.
Hmmm I prefer this over Midnight in paris??

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in there that got you interested, other than that the movie was pretty busy with funny dialog. My personal picks are Ryan Philippe and Antonio Banderas (I think he did a great job). So if you like funny movies definitely check it out!<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1985's "Too Beautiful to Die" and reworked again for Ridley Scott's Brother. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople are stopping anyone going near the felines that live around it, has dark forces taken over the townsfolk minds?
